title: Britons waste £4million on Christmas train tickets - Here's how to save
text:
Many people waste money buying train tickets on the day of travel GETTY The last Saturday before Christmas is tipped to be the busiest day for travel 
Save even more cash on tickets *Split your tickets - bizarrely it can often be cheaper to buy two single tickets for a journey rather than one. For example, the price of travel from London to Worthing can be cut by buying a single ticket from London to Horley and then Horley to Worthing.You don't need to get off the train, but the train must call at the split station to validate the journey. Moneysavingexpert.com has a free tool where you can find split tickets for your travel route. *Book direct from the rail operator that you're travelling with to get the best prices on tickets without booking fees*Travel with another two or more friends or family members, if you're able to arrange it, and buy your tickets together to save up to 20 per cent on prices. *If you register for an account with a number of train operators, including Virgin and Great Western, you can also collect 2 nectar point for every £1 you spend on tickets.
